DID YOU KNOW

What Would Happen If You Lose Oxygen For Five Seconds?

  Domnet Web      26 November 2019

Imagine if all the oxygen on our planet Earth disappeared, Let say not forever, but just for 5 seconds;
What would happen to our environment?
What would happen to our Atmosphere?
Would we survive to count the 5 seconds?
Here is what will happen if we lost oxygen for 5 Seconds.

Oxygen may not be the most abundant gas in the atmosphere (like Nitrogen), but it is certainly the most important one. Without it, no living being can survive. 5 seconds may not sound like a whole lot of time to be without oxygen. Most of us can go at least 30 seconds without taking a breath, it would happen so fast for your body to even notice. Your breathing would actually remain normal but for everything else the results would be catastrophic.

In just 5 seconds the earth will become a different place, because we would say goodbye to all our Five Star Hotels and Sky Scrappers. These structures would instantly collapse.
Oxygen is an important binder in concrete structures, without it, the concrete compounds cannot hold their rigidity.

Pieces of untreated metals in contact would instantly become welded to each other; The reason metals don't weld on contact is that they are coated in a layer of oxidation which prevents them from welding together.

If probably it's happen that you were relaxing in the beach at the time expect a severe sunburn; Our depleted Ozone layer is our protection against the sun's UV rays, it is entirely comprised of molecular oxygen bounded by three atoms of oxygen (03), it basically mean that the earth would be extremely hot and unhabitable.
However, in addition to the sunburn, our inner ear would explode. Losing oxygen means losing 21% of our air pressure.

Without oxygen, there's no fire - the combustion process in vehicles won't be able to occur, meaning our car engines would instantly stop working apart from Electric vehicles and also planes would fall form the sky.

The Sky would be completely dark, because light from the sun reaches the Earth's surface as a result of mulitple reflections that occur when light particles bounce off the particles in the air. The absence of oxygen would mean no particles for the light rays to bounce on.

Take a sit and take a nice deep breath because the earth isn't losing any of it's 21% of oxygen and feel how satisfying that is and also knowing that this will never happen.
